timeline.message: Allow TTEXT to serialize enums as strings

timeline.bodyText: This is to avoid an unnecessary call to getCurrentFieldClassIfIs(). I can remove it if you consider the impact insignificant
timeline.author: KarboniteKream

timeline.bodyText: This doesn't sound right to me because writeEnumsAsString is only useful for TEXT protocol. How about reverting this and let a user refer to TEXT_ENUM directly?
timeline.author: trustin

replies.bodyText: Sure! The reason I wrote this is that if you set writeEnumsAsString in ThriftJacksonModule, you might assume that behavior will work for all protocols
replies.author: KarboniteKream

replies.bodyText: I think it's fine since TEXT_ENUM is not really a default behavior. For less confusion, how about removing TEXT_ENUM and letting a user get the TProtocolFactory via TTextProtocolFactory.get(true)?
replies.author: trustin

replies.bodyText: Alternatively, we could register a new SerializationFormat? Then this problem could go away completely.
replies.author: trustin

replies.bodyText: Done. I had to name the protocol ttext-named-enum since underscores are not allowed.
replies.author: KarboniteKream

timeline.bodyText: How about keeping the old method as well for backward compatibility?
timeline.author: trustin
ikhoon
